ch.hevs.gdx2d.lib

Class GdxGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.hevs.gdx2d.lib.GdxGraphics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class GdxGraphics
extends Object
implements Disposable
    A game graphic class implementation based on the LibGDX library.

    The GdxGraphics class has a similar interface to the FunGraphics class used for the INF1 course given at the University of Applied Sciences School in Sion.

    The main objective of this implementation is to provide a simple, yet powerful, set of graphics primitives used for the projects that take place in this course.

    Comments are welcome !

    Version:
    1.61
    Author:
    Pierre-André Mudry (mui), Nils Chatton (chn), Christopher Métrailler (mei)

      • drawFPS

        public void drawFPS()
        Draw frame per second (FPS) information in the bottom left corner of the screen. The default Color.WHITE color is used.
        See Also:

      • drawSchoolLogo

        public void drawSchoolLogo()
        Draw the University of Applied Sciences Western Switzerland logo in the bottom right corner of the screen.

        As this project is mainly aimed the students from the inf1 course given at the HES-SO Valais, systems engineering, it is nice to have a logo for them !

        See Also:
        drawSchoolLogoUpperRight()

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(float p1x,
                     float p1y,
                     float p2x,
                     float p2y)
        Draw a line with the current currentColor.

        The line starts at P(p1x, p1y) and ends at P(p1x, p1y).

        Parameters:
        p1x - start coordinate X
        p1y - start coordinate Y
        p2x - end coordinate X
        p2y - end coordinate Y

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(float p1x,
                     float p1y,
                     float p2x,
                     float p2y,
                     Color c)
        Draws a line with a specific color.

        The line starts at P(p1x, p1y) and ends at P(p1x, p1y). The currentColor is not modified.

        Parameters:
        p1x - start coordinate X
        p1y - start coordinate Y
        p2x - end coordinate X
        p2y - end coordinate Y
        c - the color of the line

        public void drawCircle(float centerX,
                       float centerY,
                       float radius,
                       Color c)
        Draw an empty (non filled) circle with a custom color.

        The currentColor is not modified.

        Parameters:
        centerX - center X position of the circle
        centerY - center Y position of the circle
        radius - radius of the circle, in pixel
        c - the color to fill the circle with

      • drawAntiAliasedCircle

        public void drawAntiAliasedCircle(float centerX,
                                  float centerY,
                                  float radius,
                                  Color c)
        Draw an anti-aliased circle (with nice border without jaggies).

        The performance for drawing such circles is still pretty slow. You should avoid this method when you have many circles to draw.

        The currentColor is not modified.

        Parameters:
        centerX - center X position of the circle
        centerY - center Y position of the circle
        radius - radius of the circle, in pixel
        c - the color to fill the circle with

      • drawFilledCircle

        public void drawFilledCircle(float centerX,
                             float centerY,
                             float radius,
                             Color c)
        Draw a filled circle with a custom color.

        Depending on the circle radius, either a texture is drawn or a "real" circle. This method is fast.

        Parameters:
        centerX - center X position of the circle
        centerY - center Y position of the circle
        radius - radius of the circle, in pixel
        c - the color to fill the circle with

      • drawFilledBorderedCircle

        public void drawFilledBorderedCircle(float centerX,
                                     float centerY,
                                     float radius,
                                     Color inner,
                                     Color outer)
        Draw a filled circle with a border.

        This does not work really well as of now. This should be improved in a future version of the library.

        Parameters:
        centerX - center X position of the circle
        centerY - center Y position of the circle
        radius - radius of the circle to be drawn. Note that the actual circle has a radius which is 3 pixels larger
        inner - inner Color (used inside the circle)
        outer - outer Color (used for the border)

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
                       float posY,
                       String str)
        Draw a text at a specified position.

        The default font type and font size is used and the text is left aligned. The text position reference is the top left corner.

        Parameters:
        posX - left position of the text
        posY - top position of the text
        str - the text to display on the screen
        See Also:
        drawString(float, float, String, BitmapFont, int)

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
                       float posY,
                       String str,
                       BitmapFont f)
        Draw a text with a specific font at a specified position.

        The text position reference is the top left edge. By default, the text is left aligned.

        Parameters:
        posX - left position of the text
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display on the screen
        f - the custom font to use

      • drawString

        public void drawString(float posX,
                       float posY,
                       String str,
                       int align)
        Draw a text at a specified position.

        The text position reference is the top left edge. Can be left, right or center aligned.

        Parameters:
        posX - left, right or center position of the text
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display on the screen
        align - left, center or right aligned

      • drawString

                       float posY,

                       BitmapFont f,
                       int align)

        Parameters:
        posX - left, right or center position of the text
        posY - Y top position of the text
        str - the text to display on the screen
        f - the custom font to use
        align - left, center or right aligned

                               String str)

        The default font type and font size is used.

        Parameters:

        str - the text to display

      • drawPicture

        public void drawPicture(float posX,
                        float posY,
                        BitmapImage bitmap)

        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                                   float posY,
                                   float angle,
                                   float scale,
                                   BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draws a picture at a specific position with a scale and an angle.

        The center of rotation is located in the middle of the image.

        Parameters:
        posX - X coordinate in the screen space
        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space
        angle - the rotation angle, in degree
        scale - scale of the image to draw (1 is not scaled)
        bitmap - the image to draw

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                                   float posY,
                                   float angle,
                                   float width,
                                   float height,
                                   BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draw a stretched picture at a specific position.
        Parameters:
        posX - X coordinate in the screen space
        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space
        angle - the rotation angle, in degree
        width - the width of the resulting image (which will be scaled for display)
        height - the height of the resulting image
        bitmap - the image to draw

      • drawTransformedPicture

        public void drawTransformedPicture(float posX,
                                   float posY,
                                   float centerX,
                                   float centerY,
                                   float angle,
                                   float scale,
                                   BitmapImage bitmap)
        Draw a picture at a specific position with a custom center of rotation.
        Parameters:
        posX - X coordinate in the screen space
        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space
        centerX - X position of the rotation center
        centerY - Y position of the rotation center
        angle - the rotation angle, in degree
        scale - scale of the image to draw (1 is not scaled)
        bitmap - the image to draw

      • drawAlphaPicture

        public void drawAlphaPicture(Vector2 pos,
                             float alpha,
                             BitmapImage img)
        Draw a picture at a specific position with transparency (alpha).
        Parameters:
        pos - the Vector2 position to draw the image
        alpha - transparency value (0.0 is transparent, 1.0 is opaque)
        img - the image to draw

      • drawAlphaPicture

        public void drawAlphaPicture(float posX,
                             float posY,
                             float alpha,
                             BitmapImage img)

        Parameters:
        posX - X coordinate in the screen space
        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space
        alpha - transparency value (0.0 is transparent, 1.0 is opaque)
        img - the image to draw
        See Also:
        drawAlphaPicture(Vector2, float, BitmapImage)

      • drawAlphaPicture

        public void drawAlphaPicture(float posX,
                             float posY,
                             float angle,
                             float scale,
                             float alpha,
                             BitmapImage img)

        Parameters:
        posX - X coordinate in the screen space
        posY - Y coordinate in the screen space
        angle - the rotation angle, in degree
        scale - scale of the image to draw (1 is not scaled)
        alpha - transparency value (0.0 is transparent, 1.0 is opaque)
        img - the image to draw

        the current OrthographicCamera

      • moveCamera

        public void moveCamera(float x,
                       float y)
        Move the camera to a fixed position.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the camera
        y - Y position of the camera

      • moveCamera

        public void moveCamera(float interest_x,
                       float interest_y,
                       float world_width,
                       float world_height)
        Point the camera to the center of interest limited by the game size.
        Parameters:
        interest_x - X position of the center of interest
        interest_y - Y position of the center of interest
        world_width - max width of the game
        world_height - max height of the game

      • resetCamera

        public void resetCamera()
        Resets the camera at its original location, in the center of the screen.

      • scroll

        public void scroll(float dx,
                   float dy)
        Translate the camera by a value on the X and Y axes.
        Parameters:
        dx - displacement along the x axis, can be positive or negative
        dy - displacement along the y axis, can be positive or negative

      • zoom

        public void zoom(float factor)
        Zooms in and out the camera.
        Parameters:
        factor - zoom factor (1 is the default zoom-level)

      • drawShader

        public void drawShader()
        Draw the current assigned shader.

      • drawShader

        public void drawShader(float shaderTime)
        Draw the current assigned shader.
        Parameters:
        shaderTime - the current time that is passed to the fragment shader

      • drawShader

        public void drawShader(int posX,
                       int posY,
                       float shaderTime)
        Request shader rendering that passes an uniform value with the current rendering location.
        Parameters:
        posX - value passed to the shader, might be discarded
        posY - value passed to the shader, might be discarded
        shaderTime - value passed to the shader, might be discarded

      • setShader

        public void setShader(String s)
        Set a shader to be drawn.
        Parameters:
        s - the path of the shader file

      • setShader

        public void setShader(String s,
                      int width,
                      int height)
        Set a shader to be drawn with a specific size.
        Parameters:
        s - the path of the shader file
        height - height of the texture to draw the shader on
        width - width of the texture to draw the shader on

      • getShaderRenderer

        public ShaderRenderer getShaderRenderer()
        Get the shader renderer.
        Returns:
        the shader renderer

      • setShaderRenderer

        public void setShaderRenderer(ShaderRenderer shaderRenderer)
        Set a custom shader renderer.
        Parameters:
        shaderRenderer - the shader renderer

      • setBlendFunction

        public void setBlendFunction(int srcFunc,
                             int dstFunc)
        Set blending function on the SpriteBatch.
        Parameters:
        srcFunc - source blending function
        dstFunc - destination blending function
        See Also:
        resetBlend()

      • resetBlend

        public void resetBlend()
        Restore the default blending function on the SpriteBatch.
